page.title: 14ESTATE FORESTRY -HOUGHTON
page.content: There are 3OO acres of broadleaf,25O acres of mixed woodland, small stands of poplar in wet areas and in the 3OO acres of parkland a further 2-3OO trees. The silviculture practised in the Houghton woodlands emphasises natural regeneration. If this fails group planting is used with uneven age age development; clear felling is avoided. Oak, beech, ash, sycamore and larch are grown on shallow sands over lying the chalk and Scots pine, cypress, Tsuga ,Thuga and Douglas fir on deeper deposits and boulder clay.A head forester and 5 men work the woodlands but the felling is done by contractors under license. Hard woods are sold for furniture and veneer and soft woods for building and joinery. In addition to its commercial role the forest prevents wind blow, gives shelter to game and is an amenity.
